description: The Educational Assistance scheme by the Andaman and Nicobar Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (ANBOCWWB) provides financial support to the children of registered construction workers for their education from primary to higher secondary levels. The scheme aims to promote education among workersâ€™ families.
key_features: Financial support for children of registered construction workers
Covers primary to higher secondary education
Supports school fees and educational materials

benefits.assistance_amount: Varies based on educational level and board guidelines
benefits.coverage: School fees, books, uniforms, and other expenses

education_criteria: Children enrolled in primary, secondary, or higher secondary classes
Must be studying in recognized schools
additional_criteria: Parent must be a registered construction worker with ANBOCWWB
Must be a resident of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
institution_criteria: Government or recognized private schools in Andaman and Nicobar Islands

steps: Obtain application form from ANBOCWWB office

required_documents.note: To prove Andaman and Nicobar residency

special_notes: Limited to children of registered construction workers
Assistance amount varies based on educational level
Renewal requires proof of continued enrollment
